com.vector.annotations.publishedapi

Annotation Type UsesPublishedApiFrom


  • @PublishedApi(value=CLASS_DEPENDENCY)
 @Documented
 @Retention(value=CLASS)
 @Target(value={TYPE,CONSTRUCTOR,METHOD,ANNOTATION_TYPE})
 @Repeatable(value=UsesPublishedApiFromContainer.class)
public @interface UsesPublishedApiFrom
    The @UsesPublishedApiFrom marks a method, field or class using PublishedApi from a newer version than the minimal API version. This will disable the compile error, when using newer API.

    Client side code shall use the the field of the version class, instead of literal strings.
    Sample usage with default domain GENERATORS: 

     

  @UsesPublishedApiFrom(version = GeneratorApiVersion.VERSION_GENERATORS_R14)
  public void myMethod(){
  }

    Sample with explicit DomainType: 
     

  @UsesPublishedApiFrom(version = GeneratorApiVersion.VERSION_GENERATORS_R14, domainType = GeneratorApiVersion.DOMAIN_GENERATORS)
  public void myMethod(){
  }

    Sample with disabled runtime check (Please use this flag only if you have a performance critical code section. AFTER you have measured it!): 
     

  @UsesPublishedApiFrom(version = GeneratorApiVersion.VERSION_GENERATORS_R14, disableRuntimeVersionCheck=false)
  public void myMethod(){
  }

    A client side element could have multiple annotation of the type UsesPublishedApiFrom, but NOT for the same DomainType. It is a compile time error to use multiple annotation with the same DomainType on one element.

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String version
      The version of the PublishedApi to use.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean disableRuntimeVersionCheck
      If true, the runtime version check is disabled, otherwise the runtime version check is enabled.
      java.lang.String domainType
      The DomainType to use, as string.

    • Element Detail

      • version

        @PublishedMethod
public abstract java.lang.String version
        The version of the PublishedApi to use.

        Note: the version shall correspond to the selected DomainType, see domainType().

        Client side code shall use the the field of the corresponding version class, instead of literal strings: 

         

        @UsesPublishedApiFrom(version = GeneratorApiVersion.VERSION_GENERATORS_R14, domain = GeneratorApiVersion.DOMAIN_GENERATORS)
        public void myMethod(){
        }

        Returns:
        the string

      • disableRuntimeVersionCheck

        @PublishedMethod
public abstract boolean disableRuntimeVersionCheck
        If true, the runtime version check is disabled, otherwise the runtime version check is enabled.

        The ApiVersioning compiler addon will generate a RuntimeVersion check into all methods, were this flag is false. This check will guarantee, that the method is not used without a proper version check.

        Please use this flag only if you have a performance critical code section. AFTER you have measured it!

        Returns:
        true, if the runtime version check is disabled.
        Default:
        false

      • domainType

        @PublishedMethod
public abstract java.lang.String domainType
        The DomainType to use, as string. The default is DomainType.GENERATORS, if nothing is specified.

        Client side code shall use the the domain field of the corresponding version class, instead of literal strings: 

         

  @UsesPublishedApiFrom(version = GeneratorApiVersion.VERSION_GENERATORS_R14, domain = GeneratorApiVersion.DOMAIN_GENERATORS)
  public void myMethod(){
  }

        Returns:
        the domainType to verify against.
        Default:
        "GENERATORS"
